poem:
"Echoes from the Continent"

Steeled hearts relent, borders melt,
See younglings wander, free in field and fens.
Across the roughened seas, once felt,
Negotiations stir, new hope ascends.

Yet in silent corners of frost-kissed Albion,
The soil remembers, an age-old jinx.
In groaned words, the maddened sermon,
'Beware the echo from Brussels', it hints.

Our land sits solitary, aloof,
With or without the EU's youth.
